nodes.text: Drabatese was the native language of the Drabatan species.

It was a complex language that strung together discrete syllables into long, unwieldy words that encompassed multilayered ideas. It was also spoken very loudly; context, tense and other grammatical concepts being determined by volume.
When quieter speech was required, Drabatans switched to a secondary form of communication in which they passed air through a vocal pouch.
